SUMMARY: The entertainment giant said it would raise prices for nearly all of its streaming plans and introduce “continuous playlists”—or channels showing a steady stream of curated content—on Disney+ later this year.

TITLE: Microsoft Says Delta's Technology Outdated, Likely Contributed to Slow Recovery
SUMMARY: The assertion, in a letter from a lawyer for the tech giant, is a response to Delta’s claims that exposure to Microsoft and CrowdStrike was at the root of its problems from a July IT outage.

TITLE: Uber Shares Jump as Company Returns to Profitability
SUMMARY: Second-quarter results beat expectations, and the company projected sales growth.

TITLE: Aramco Plans $31 Billion Payout After Profit Beat
SUMMARY: Aramco said its second-quarter net profit beat market estimates, and that it planned to pay $31 billion in dividends to the Saudi government and its shareholders.

TITLE: How Going to the Movies Is Changing, in Charts
SUMMARY: Hollywood’s new normal involves fewer wide releases, more big screens and novelty popcorn.

TITLE: Why Californians Have Some of the Highest Power Bills in the U.S.
SUMMARY: Utilities are investing billions to upgrade infrastructure and build out green energy, passing budget-breaking costs to households.

TITLE: Bloomberg News Parts Ways With Reporter Involved in Article About Evan Gershkovich's Release
SUMMARY: The news outlet, which took disciplinary action against several staffers, says the premature article “could have endangered” the prisoner swap.

TITLE: Google Loses Antitrust Case Over Search-Engine Dominance
SUMMARY: A federal judge ruled that the company acted illegally to maintain its monopoly status.

TITLE: Streamers Can't Get Enough of True Story TV. Cue the Lawsuits.
SUMMARY: Litigation challenging popular shows like “Baby Reindeer” is making it more expensive to produce content for companies like Netflix.

TITLE: It's Getting Harder for Companies to Keep Politics Out of the Workplace
SUMMARY: Employers teach de-escalation techniques as divisive political discussions become almost impossible to avoid.

TITLE: Woodside to Buy Ammonia Plant From OCI Global for $2.35 Billion
SUMMARY: Woodside Energy will buy an ammonia plant under construction in Texas for around $2.35 billion as it seeks greener assets to balance a portfolio that generates most of its profits from oil and natural gas production.

TITLE: L'Oreal Buys Stake in Swiss Skincare Company Galderma
SUMMARY: L’Oreal agreed to buy the 10% stake, valued at roughly $1.9 billion, to bolster its exposure to the fast-growing market for aesthetic injections such as fillers.

TITLE: Infineon Cuts Guidance Again as Chip Glut Weighs on Recovery
SUMMARY: Infineon lowered its sales forecasts for the third time this year as the inventory glut that is pervading the semiconductor industry continues to translate into fewer orders for chips in smartphones, cars and industrial machinery.

TITLE: Societe Generale to Sell U.K., Swiss Private Banks for $982 Million
SUMMARY: The French bank agreed to sell its private banking divisions in the U.K. and Switzerland for around and to dispose of its Madagascar subsidiary as it makes progress on its strategy to simplify the business by offloading noncore assets.

TITLE: Burgers, Botox and Birkins: Consumer Pullback Hits China and U.S.
SUMMARY: From McDonald’s to Mercedes-Benz, executives are saying that many consumers in China and the U.S. are pulling back on spending, but for different reasons.

TITLE: Small Businesses Make Hard Choices as Insurance Costs Surge
SUMMARY: Some are raising prices. Others are adopting stricter screening for job candidates, adding workplace safety training and weighing changes to employee healthcare coverage.

TITLE: CrowdStrike to Delta: Stop Pointing the Finger at Us
SUMMARY: The cybersecurity company says it isn’t to blame for the airline’s dayslong meltdown, calling it a “misleading narrative.”

TITLE: FedEx's Logistics Test: Getting Rid of Duplicate Trucks
SUMMARY: Delivery company is discovering technology and productivity challenges as it works to merge its Express and Ground networks.

TITLE: Elon Musk's X Sues Advertising Coalition Over 'Massive' Boycott
SUMMARY: The lawsuit alleges companies including CVS Health, Mars and Unilever unfairly targeted the social-media platform over safety standards.

TITLE: Glencore to Retain Coal Assets
SUMMARY: Glencore said it would keep its coal unit following the acquisition of Elk Valley Resources, as it unexpectedly reported a net loss for the first half of the year.

TITLE: Maersk Reports Lower Profit
SUMMARY: Maersk on Wednesday posted a drop in second-quarter net profit, despite strong container-shipping demand in a market of supply-chain disruptions.

TITLE: Commerzbank Confirms Guidance, Announces Buyback
SUMMARY: Commerzbank announced a $656 million share buyback and confirmed its full-year guidance after its first-half results were in line with forecasts.

TITLE: Tesla Recalling Cars in China Over Hood Problem
SUMMARY: The carmaker is recalling 1.68 million cars in China to fix the same hood problem that recently affected models in the U.S.

TITLE: Siemens Energy Keeps Guidance as Loss Narrows
SUMMARY: Siemens Energy reported a reduced net loss for the third quarter as revenue rose 19%, with its wind unit continuing to recover following restructuring efforts.

TITLE: Cathay Pacific to Buy Airbus Jets for About $11 Billion
SUMMARY: Cathay Pacific Airways said it would buy 30 Airbus aircraft for about $11 billion and has the option to buy an additional 30 jets.

TITLE: Florida's Space Coast Braces for Impact---From Elon Musk
SUMMARY: SpaceX wants to launch the world’s largest and most powerful rocket dozens of times annually in an area that has gotten crowded with people and cruise ships since the Apollo era.

TITLE: NASA Says Starliner Astronauts Could Return With SpaceX---Next Year
SUMMARY: Officials confirmed at a briefing that NASA is considering using SpaceX for the return trip. Boeing says its craft is safe for crew.

TITLE: Disney Posts First-Ever Streaming Profit, Warns of Pressure on Theme-Parks Business
SUMMARY: The box-office success of ‘Inside Out 2’ helped the movie studio turn around its fortunes.

TITLE: Elon Musk's Plan for Monster Rocket  Rattles Florida's Space Coast
SUMMARY: SpaceX wants to launch the world’s largest and most powerful rocket dozens of times annually in an area that has gotten crowded with people and cruise ships since the Apollo era.

TITLE: Shopify Tops Views in Quarter and Sees Growth Accelerating
SUMMARY: Shopify projected better-than-expected sales growth for the current quarter after attracting more merchants and withstanding a shaky consumer spending environment.

TITLE: Maersk Orders LNG Ships and Takes a Detour on Its Green Goals
SUMMARY: CEO Vincent Clerc pledged to avoid vessels run on liquefied natural gas and focus on methanol-powered ships that emit no carbon dioxide.

TITLE: Glencore Sticks With Coal, Cites Pendulum Shift on ESG
SUMMARY: The decision to keep mining the fossil fuel is the latest signal that the finance world’s sustainable-investing craze is fizzling out.

TITLE: Huge Fire Sparked by a Mercedes-Benz EV Adds to Safety Concerns Dogging Industry
SUMMARY: A blaze in South Korea prompts debate over whether electric vehicles should be allowed in the country’s ubiquitous underground parking lots.

TITLE: DBS Names CEO Successor
SUMMARY: The Singapore banking heavyweight also raised guidance and reported a quarterly profit beat.

TITLE: CVS's Medicare Woes Continue to Fuel More Cuts to Its Outlook
SUMMARY: The healthcare company reported higher revenue but much of the sales increase was offset by higher medical costs.

TITLE: Honda Motor Reports Higher Profit Despite Weak Car Sales in China
SUMMARY: The Japanese company maintained its revenue and net profit forecasts for the fiscal year.

TITLE: SoftBank Plans $3.5 Billion Buyback After Surprise Quarterly Loss
SUMMARY: The Japanese technology investor reported a surprise first-quarter loss after two consecutive quarters of profits.

TITLE: The Battle Over Disability Pay and Mental-Health Leave
SUMMARY: Employees’ requests for paid time off for mental-health conditions are denied at a higher rate than straight medical claims, data show.

TITLE: Puma Slumps After Trimming Profit Target
SUMMARY: Puma narrowed its earnings guidance for the current year, citing muted consumer sentiment, particularly in China, as well as higher freight costs and changing duties.

TITLE: Continental Cuts Sales Guidance on Lower Car Production
SUMMARY: Continental now anticipates 2024 production of cars and light commercial vehicles to fall between 1% to 3%.

TITLE: Warner Bros. Discovery Posts Nearly $10 Billion Loss
SUMMARY: The loss includes a $9.1 billion impairment charge tied to the plunging value of its linear networks.

TITLE: Bumble Shares Drop to All-Time Low After Cut in FY Outlook
SUMMARY: Bumble forecasts revenue of $269 million to $275 million, below the $296.4 million expected by analysts.

TITLE: Zillow Promotes Operating Chief Jeremy Wacksman to Chief Executive Role
SUMMARY: Outgoing CEO and co-founder Rich Barton will remain on Zillow’s board as co-executive chair alongside co-founder Lloyd Frink.

TITLE: Netflix Taps CBS Sports to Produce Its Christmas NFL Games
SUMMARY: Netflix said it has struck a deal to have CBS Sports produce the two National Football League games the streamer is carrying this Christmas.

TITLE: Algonquin Power to Sell Renewable Energy Business for $2.5 Billion
SUMMARY: Algonquin Power & Utilities has agreed to sell its renewable energy business for $2.5 billion as it transforms into a pure-play regulated utility.

TITLE: Merck Buying Drug Targeting B-Cell Diseases for Up to $1.3 Billion
SUMMARY: Merck has struck a deal worth up to $1.3 billion to buy an investigational drug targeting B-cell associated diseases.

TITLE: Indian EV Maker Ola Electric Jumps in Trading Debut
SUMMARY: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility jumped in their trading debut, reflecting strong investor interest in India’s nascent electric-vehicle market.

TITLE: Luxury Brands Increase Prices in Japan Amid Sales Surge, Yen Weakness
SUMMARY: Some luxury brands are pushing through price increases in Japan, as tourists snapping up high-end goods turn the country into a bright spot for an otherwise downbeat industry.

TITLE: Hargreaves Lansdown Agrees to Takeover by Private-Equity Consortium
SUMMARY: Hargreaves Lansdown has agreed to a takeover offer from a CVC-backed private-equity consortium that values the U.K. retail-investment platform at $6.9 billion.

TITLE: Americans Are Skipping Theme Parks This Summer
SUMMARY: Disney, Six Flags and Universal’s owner reported softer results as consumers pull back—or travel abroad.

TITLE: A Lot Was Riding on This Wind Farm. Then Giant Shards Washed Up in Nantucket.
SUMMARY: The industry was dealt a setback after a turbine blade broke at one of the nation’s largest planned offshore wind farms.

TITLE: Generali Profits Rise Despite Higher Natural-Disaster Costs
SUMMARY: Generali posted slightly higher operating profits and a 20% rise in gross premiums for the first half, after improved life-insurance and asset-management results offset increased natural-disaster costs.

TITLE: Samsung Recalls Over One Million Electric Stoves in U.S.
SUMMARY: Samsung Electronics is recalling more than one million electric stoves in the U.S. following reports of about 250 fires that have injured dozens of people and killed pets.

TITLE: Delta to CrowdStrike: Don't Blame Us for Tech Problems
SUMMARY: The airline says the cybersecurity company is shirking blame for the July outage, which led he carrier to cancel about 7,000 flights.

TITLE: Playboy to Bring Back Print Magazine After Covid Shutdown
SUMMARY: PLBY Group said that it’s relaunching Playboy Magazine with an annual edition that will be released in February 2025, a decision that comes about four years after announcing it would be shut down as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Paramount Writes Down Value of Cable-TV Business by $6 Billion and Cuts 2,000 Jobs
SUMMARY: Paramount Global, home of Comedy Central, MTV and Nickelodeon, wrote down the value of its cable-TV networks by nearly $6 billion and cut 15% of its workforce, a day after rival Warner Bros. Discovery reported an even larger write-down.

TITLE: Amazon's $4 Billion Investment in Anthropic Comes Under U.K. Scrutiny
SUMMARY: U.K. antitrust officials are probing whether Amazon’s multibillion-dollar investment in artificial-intelligence company Anthropic poses a threat to competition.

TITLE: Boeing's New CEO Is Hands On. He's Being Handed a Company in Crisis.
SUMMARY: Robert “Kelly” Ortberg will need both strategic vision and an eye for detail as he tries to revamp a manufacturing giant that has been hobbled by production delays, factory flubs and quality lapses.

TITLE: Indeed and Glassdoor Owner Posts Profit Rise
SUMMARY: Recruit Holdings reported a rise in first-quarter net profit, thanks to stronger earnings from its human-resources technology business and other key segments.

TITLE: Supplying Saks Was a Soapmaker's Dream Until He Got a $74 Check
SUMMARY: Saks is an unusual example of a large retailer that has been withholding funds from some luxury brands for months.

TITLE: Allianz Lifts Buyback to €1.5 Billion After Strong Second Quarter
SUMMARY: Allianz increased its planned share buyback for 2024 and maintained its outlook after it reported better-than-expected results for the second quarter.

TITLE: China's Sales of EVs, Hybrids Surpass Conventional Cars in July
SUMMARY: Sales of electric vehicles and hybrids in China surpassed that of internal-combustion-engine cars for the first time ever in July, despite weak overall demand.
